edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.commitmentScheme.elGamal

Class CmtElGamalOnByteArrayCommitter

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.commitmentScheme.elGamal.CmtElGamalCommitterCore
      • edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.commitmentScheme.elGamal.CmtElGamalOnByteArrayCommitter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CmtCommitter, CmtOnByteArray, CommitSecLevel, PerfectlyBindingCmt, SecureCommit, SecurityLevel

    public class CmtElGamalOnByteArrayCommitter
extends CmtElGamalCommitterCore
implements CmtCommitter, PerfectlyBindingCmt, CmtOnByteArray
    This class implements the committer side of the ElGamal commitment.

    It uses El Gamal encryption for byte arrays, that is, the encryption class used is ScElGamalOnbyteArray. This default cannot be changed.

    The pseudo code of this protocol can be found in Protocol 3.4 of pseudo codes document at http://cryptobiu.github.io/scapi/SDK_Pseudocode.pdf.

    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

      • CmtElGamalOnByteArrayCommitter

        public CmtElGamalOnByteArrayCommitter(Channel channel,
                              DlogGroup dlog,
                              KeyDerivationFunction kdf,
                              java.security.SecureRandom random)
                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                      SecurityLevelException,
                                      InvalidDlogGroupException,
                                      java.io.IOException
        This constructor lets the caller pass the channel, the dlog group and the KeyDerivation function to work with. The El Gamal option (ScElGamalOnByteArray)is set by default by the constructor and cannot be changed.
        Parameters:
        channel - used for the communication
        dlog - Dlog group
        kdf - key derivation function
        random -

        InvalidDlogGroupException

      • generateCommitmentMsg

        public CmtCCommitmentMsg generateCommitmentMsg(CmtCommitValue input,
                                      long id)
        Description copied from class: CmtElGamalCommitterCore
        Computes the commitment object of the commitment scheme.

        Pseudo code:

        "SAMPLE random values r <- Zq

        COMPUTE u = g^r and v = h^r * x".

        Specified by:
        generateCommitmentMsg in interface CmtCommitter
        Overrides:
        generateCommitmentMsg in class CmtElGamalCommitterCore
        Parameters:
        input - The value that the committer commits about.
        id - Unique value attached to the input to keep track of the commitments in the case that many commitments are performed one after the other without decommiting them yet.
        Returns:
        the created commitment.

      • commit

        public void commit(CmtCommitValue input,
          long id)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Runs the commit phase of the commitment scheme.

        Pseudo code:

        "SAMPLE random values r <- Zq

        COMPUTE u = g^r and v = h^r * x

        SEND c = (h,u,v) to R".

        Specified by:
        commit in interface CmtCommitter
        Overrides:
        commit in class CmtElGamalCommitterCore
        Parameters:
        input - The value that the committer commits about.
        id - Unique value attached to the input to keep track of the commitments in the case that many commitments are performed one after the other without decommiting them yet.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is any problem at the communication level
